page.title: 02Introduction<cont.>
page.content: The moutains have changed little in the last hundred years.Sheep graze along with the mountain ponies.The mountain roads are now tarmacadamed and with the increase in car ownership,much greater use is made by the local inhabitants of these roads. The Head of the Valley road is now only six miles away and with the closure of our railway station and the reduction in the bus services provided by South Wales Transport,the car plays an important part in our daily lives. Also,the opening this year of the{A470 <South Wales to North Wales Trunk road> duel carriageway,will also affect this area.
